titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid of the UW-Milwaukee Employment and Training Insitute, 1976-2015

did.unittitle: UW-Milwaukee Employment and Training Insitute, 1976-2015

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. Employment and Training Institute

extref.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department

did.abstract: The Employment and Training Institute (ETI) is part of the School of Continuing Education and addresses the needs of unemployed and underemployed Wisconsin workers and families. The collection is comprised of education and employment publications on GED assessments, post-secondary education and employment for GED and Milwaukee Public School (MPS) graduates, and the labor market and AFDC single-parent employment in Milwaukee. Also included in the collection are job opening and job seeker surveys and newsclippings on MPS desegregation.

bioghist.p: The Employment and Training Institute (ETI) was established in 1978 by the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee and the University of Wisconsin-Extension to address the educational and training needs of unemployed and underemployed Wisconsin workers and families. ETI is part of UW-Extension's continuing commitment to the "Wisconsin Idea" - that university research should be applied to solve problems and improve the quality of life for all Wisconsin citizens.

ETI addresses the needs of Wisconsin workers through applied research, policy development, and community education. Philip E. Lerman served as first director of ETI from 1978 to 1988. John Pawasarat has served as director since 1988.

scopecontent.p: The majority of the collection contains research and training publications produced between 1980 and 2003. Publications include GED and MPS graduate employment and post-secondary education readiness, juvenile ex-offender and youth employment, Metropolitian Milwaukee job opening surveys, and Milwaukee County educational and employment guide and single parent AFDC population and employment earnings. The collection also contains local newsclippings from 1976 on MPS desegregation.

arrangement.p: The files are organized alphabetically by subject, then chronologically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material in the UWM Libraries

accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials, and the collection is open to all members of the public in accordance with state law.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of libel, privacy, and copyright which may be involved in the use of this collection (Wisconsin Statutes 19.21-19.39).

acqinfo.p: (PLS CHK THIS) The ETI Collection was transferred to the Archives as part of accession 2016-036 in February 2017.

processinfo.p: Phyllis Reske minimally processed accession 2016-036 in March 2017. Milwaukee Urban Observatory publications were transferred to the UW-Milwaukee Milwaukee Urban Observatory Records collection.
